channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Decisions as effort
item.description: Why are we more likely to get tasks done than to take on new initiatives? Checking something off a to-do list requires far less emotional energy than ...

item.title: Foundering or floundering?
item.description: Floundering is flopping around and making little progress. A Dutch word for getting mired and lost. Foundering is what we call it when the ship goes d...

item.title: Empowering AI Innovation: Lessons From Judging An AI Hackathon
item.description: The projects presented at the hackathon showcased an inspiring focus on addressing pressing social issues through AI-powered solutions.

item.title: Confused about good
item.description: How often do we assume that popular things are good, and that good things become popular? If your work doesn’t catch on, does that mean it wasn’t good...

item.title: See The Comet, ‘Shooting Stars’ And Venus: The Night Sky This Week
item.description: Each Monday, I pick out North America’s celestial highlights for the week ahead.

item.title: Remote, Not Distant: Thriving In The Era Of Distributed Work
item.description: Throughout my career managing teams, I've learned that successful remote work isn't about adopting the latest tech—it's about humanizing the experienc...

item.title: COP16 Challenge: Turning USD35bn Into USD700bn Of Yearly Finance Flows To Nature
item.description: With COP16, the biodiversity COP, kicking off this week, the biggest question on the agenda is how to fund nature recovery and restoration.

item.title: Moving toward ease
item.description: “Ease” isn’t the same as “easy.” In fact, they’re often at odds. Easy work is hardly worth our effort. It can deaden us instead of giving us the chanc...

item.title: How To Leverage Knowledge Management When Building A Global Team
item.description: Adopting a global mindset acknowledges that success depends on collective intelligence, not just individual expertise.
